summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and Brittany Henderson, a trial attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC, regarding scheduling victim interviews for October 23-24, 2019, in relation to the Epstein case. The emails discuss logistics for meetings at the SDNY office.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.role: Trial Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: Represents clients (victims) in the Epstein case and coordinates scheduling of victim interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding scheduling victim interviews for the Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC, working together on victim interviews for the Epstein case.
Coordinating the scheduling of victim interviews between the victims' legal representation and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: Multiple victim interviews are scheduled to take place at the SDNY office, with specific time slots proposed.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: Additional victim interviews are scheduled to take place at the SDNY office, with morning times preferred for some.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively scheduling victim interviews in October 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, represented by Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards, was coordinating these interviews on behalf of multiple victims.
Meetings were planned to occur at the SDNY office located at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza in New York City.
The correspondence indicates logistical planning, including travel considerations for the victims to minimize time in the city.
